title: Dean Edell Medical Show 2009.01.13
description:
This is a full episode of Dr. Dean Edell's syndicated radio program, which airs on 136 stations across the United States. This episode aired on January 13, 2009 on the radio station KGO (810 AM). The radio station offers free downloads of Mr. Edell's show in its archive section here: http://www.kgoam810.com/Article.asp?id=49920 under the 1:00 p.m. - 2:00 p.m. section.

In this episode, Dr. Dean Edell comments on MRI's for obese patients, strange behavior in the economic downturn, "sleep efficiency" and its relationship to the common cold, hormone therapy and reduce brain volume in senior citizens, Vic's Vapo-Rub, cold weather's tendency to increase blood pressure in seniors, and the pro-vaccine book "Autism's False Prophets."

He answers questions about eczema, ketosis diets, Diane Summers' book "Breakthrough," different kinds of sugars, low thyroid, and grape juice vs. red wine.
